net.sourceforge.aglets.examples.patterns
Class Finger

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.aglet.Aglet
      net.sourceforge.aglets.examples.patterns.SampleAglet
          net.sourceforge.aglets.examples.patterns.Finger
All Implemented Interfaces:
CloneListener, MobilityListener, PersistencyListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class Finger
extends SampleAglet

Class Finger is used to retrieve local user information from a remote aglet server. This information includes the name, organization, email address, and the local time at the remote server. Given an URL (Agler Resource Locator) it will dispatch a slave (the FingerSlave class) to retrieve local user information. The slave will return with the information to be displayed by the master.

Version:
1.00 96/12/28, 1.01 98/11/18
Author:
Danny B. Lange, Yariv Aridor, Shintaro Kosugi
See Also:
FingerSlave, Serialized Form

Method Detail

createSlave

protected void createSlave(java.util.Vector destinations,
                           java.lang.Object obj)
Creates and sets up the slave with necessary information for it to dispatch to a remote aglet server and hopefully return safely. This method is a callback method for the interaction window.

Specified by:
createSlave in class SampleAglet
Parameters:
destinations - a vector containing the url of the destinations.
obj - the initialization object

handleMessage

public boolean handleMessage(Message msg)
Description copied from class: Aglet
Handles the message form outside.

Overrides:
handleMessage in class SampleAglet
Parameters:
msg - the message sent to the aglet
Returns:
true if the message was handled. Returns false if the message was not handled. If false is returned, the NotHandledException exception is thrown in the FutureReply.getReply and AgletProxy.sendMessage methods.
See Also:
FutureReply.getReply(), Message.sendReply(), AgletProxy.sendMessage(com.ibm.aglet.message.Message)
